intro: Pecteilis elongata, commonly known as the long-stalked pecteilis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of North America, particularly in the central and eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of the carrot family. Pecteilis elongata is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
